channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: state prepares to ease restrictions

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: The organisers of Sydney Writers' Festival have made a quick pivot to producing podcasts instead of live events.
item.title: Festival puts its faith in pod

item.dc:creator: Supratim Adhikari
item.description: Mining giant's CEO Mike Henry is confident demand for oil and steel will pick up once the global economy recovers from the ill-effects of the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: Oil demand will bounce back, says BHP boss Mike Henry

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: On his last day in the job, fire boss Shane Fitzsimmons said he had planned to step down last year but decided to stay on for one final season.
item.title: The forecast that made RFS chief stay on for one last summer

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Scott Morrison urges further downloads of COVIDSafe, global COVID-19 infections climb past 3.1 million as nation's death toll stands at 91

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Andrew Forrest-chaired mining giant Fortescue Metals has hiked its iron ore shipments target and flagged a Chinese tailwind for Australia's post-COVID-19 recovery.
item.title: 'Twiggy' Forrest's Fortescue says China key to nation's recovery

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Penrith star Nathan Cleary has received an official warning from police for flouting social distancing measures, as five women from the group were fined $1000.
item.title: Police warn Cleary, fine five women over TikTok gathering

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: Older Australians are the people who are most in need of protection from the coronavirus.
item.title: Aged care homes need more cash to cope with COVID-19

item.description: La Liga clubs will begin testing players for coronavirus next week as the first step towards restarting the season in June, a source familiar with the league's plans said on Wednesday.
item.title: Spanish soccer clubs to test ahead of training

item.description: About a quarter of the wild population of rare macadamia jansenii trees discovered in 2018 have been destroyed by the recent bushfires.
item.title: Rare macadamia trees destroyed in Queensland bushfires

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Suburban footballers are waiting for a return-to-play date across Victoria, but not all clubs are keen to get back on the park.
item.title: Why the return of local footy might not be welcomed by all

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Some households will save up to $180 on their annual power bills as plummeting global energy demand flows through to the domestic market.
item.title: Energy bill relief as gas market deflates

item.dc:creator: Angus Livingston
item.description: An event to announce $67 million for cancer funding was cancelled after tensions between Health Minister Greg Hunt and mining billionaire Andrew Forrest escalated.
item.title: Hunt and Forrest cancel cancer funding event after blindside

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: Prosecutors will call two witnesses the defence has requested to cross-examine before the court crosses to the UK to again hear from international fibres expert, Dr Ray Palmer.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: Fibre expert claims mishandling of bodies likely led to loss of trace evidence

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: The eight-part comedy series will parody the surge in parenting, home improvement and wellness advice that has emerged during the pandemic.
item.title: First new Australian comedy about life under lockdown to screen on ABC

item.description: Traffic data over the past seven days in Beijing and Shenzhen show that peak-hour congestion was heavier than the same period last year.
item.title: Traffic jams return to Chinese cities driving up fuel demand

item.description: A prominent Melbourne lawyer, who was arrested in 2004 for conspiring to kill Carl Williams only to have the charges later dropped, has successfully sued Google for defamation.
item.title: Gangland lawyer wins $40k in Google suit

item.dc:creator: David Estcourt
item.description: Flight Centre has refused to promise a full refund to a family who spent more than $18,500 on a scuttled US trip, despite them purchasing 'cancel for any reason' insurance.
item.title: Woman with muscular dystrophy hits turbulence in bid for Flight Centre refund

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: A coronavirus cluster has emerged at an aged care home in Melbourne's inner-east as the state records its highest number of new cases in more than a week.
item.title: COVID-19 cluster at aged care home linked to spike in Victorian cases

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: A Melbourne man who admitted defrauding the tax office has been spared jail, in part because he confessed almost two years ago.
item.title: Man avoids jail over tax fraud case delays

item.dc:creator: Michael Bailey
item.description: The singer-songwriter threw off the shackles of her monster hit while performing from her Mornington Peninsula home.
item.title: Tones And I livestream shows she's no one-trick monkey

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: WA's Police Commissioner says the Dockers trio caught out partying with a group of people last Sunday would not be probed any further for potential breaches of the state's coronavirus restrictions.
item.title: 'Nothing to see here': Partying Dockers get a pass from WA's top cop

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: North American correspondent Matthew Knott joins national editor Tory Maguire to discuss the situation in the United States.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: America's unruly states

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: There is one paragraph in the NRL's biosecurity plan delivered to the state and federal governments that stands out from the rest.
item.title: NRL admits to concerns about 'widespread' infection in government pitch

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: The nation's top gold miner Newcrest has launched a $1.1 billion equity raising to fund growth at mines around the world and cash in on rising gold prices.
item.title: Newcrest raises $1b for growth as virus sends gold price soaring

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Fed up of using soup cans as weights? A national hire service has launched allowing people to rent weights directly from local gyms.
item.title: With gyms closed, a new platform lets fitness lovers rent their gear online

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: No new cases and seven people recovered brings WA's active cases down to 36, as the Premier heralds the handling of Johannesburg flight into the state.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: WA records zero new cases despite African flight

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: Drug driving laws and drug testing for truck drivers could be strengthened following Eastern Freeway crash that resulted in the death of four police officers.
item.title: Drug driving laws getting a rethink in wake of Eastern Freeway tragedy

item.dc:creator: James Massola
item.description: The last remaining tourists are locked down in luxury but millions of Balinese are feeling the strain.
item.title: Bali resorts offer steep discounts to the few tourists who didn't want to leave

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: As Queenslanders get set to dust off their winter woolies, graziers in particular have been warned to take action ahead of the cool, wet and windy conditions.
item.title: Graziers get first warning in years as cold front bears down on Qld

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Cox Plate runner-up Castelvecchio has been retired to stud at Arrowfield, and the Hunter Valley farm has also poached Victoria's leading stallion Written Tycoon.
item.title: Castelvecchio retired, Written Tycoon poached by Arrowfield

item.description: An outspoken chief scientific adviser to the UK government, the late Bob May's choice of title – Baron May of Woollahra – was vetoed by Australian protocol authorities.
item.title: Bob May: the government scientist with a colourful turn of phrase

item.description: UEFA's chief medical official says it is "definitely possible" to plan a restart of European soccer leagues despite the Dutch and French ending their seasons.
item.title: Season re-starts in Europe still possible, claim UEFA

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan has urged the federal government not to “cut off their nose to spite their face” in their dealings with China if the economy is to survive the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: 'We keep the economy alive': WA Premier backs media mogul's calls to ease up on China

item.description: Commissioner Roger Goodell will not be paid during the coronavirus pandemic as part of a leadership-initiated reduction in pay by the NFL.
item.title: NFL chief to take no salary amid pandemic

item.dc:creator: Justin Rake
item.description: A petition calling supporting a WA school principal who urged parents to keep children home if they were able to has received more than 1500 signatures.
item.title: Parents, students back WA principal who sent 'keep kids home' letter

item.description: The Australia allrounder believes women's codes could provide struggling organisations with new revenue streams, and WBBL might save the summer.
item.title: 'Not necessarily a bad thing': Perry says coronavirus can help women's sport

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Mining magnate Andrew Forrest has emerged as the latest possible bidder for Virgin Australia, as administrators of the collapsed airline say 20 potential buyers are vying to keep the carrier alive.
item.title: Andrew Forrest joins 20 bidders circling Virgin Australia

item.description: Among the more fanciful notions advanced by the Russian disinformation campaign was the claim that vodka was an effective hand sanitiser.
item.title: UK's enemies are making capital out of crisis

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Sydney racing's old warhorse Isorich has a link to US swimming legend Michael Phelps - and his part-owner is only happy to keep the good times rolling.
item.title: 'It's been a fantastic ride': Isorich 113 not out ... and not stopping

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: While there are doubts about how much money the race will be worth and whether crowds will be on track, Australia's best sprinter is in the field.
item.title: First horse confirmed for The Everest

item.description: Even the powerhouse rugby nation has been unable to dodge the impact of the coronavirus pandemic, with NZR chiefs still fearing a $100 million loss in 2020.
item.title: NZ Rugby predicts 70 per cent revenue drop in more grim news for code

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Foxtel has cut more jobs as part of a restructure designed to enable it to compete with global streaming platforms.
item.title: Foxtel axes another 70 jobs in latest restructure

item.description: A Queensland man who ran a "substantial" drug trafficking business has been sentenced to more than 17 years in jail.
item.title: Queensland drug trafficker jailed for 17 years

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Sydney's run of mostly balmy and dry autumnal weather has come to a soggy April end, making way for the coldest start to May in almost four decades.
item.title: 'Impressive' cold snap to send Sydney's mercury plunging to decade lows

item.description: A man accused of killing a Queensland woman whose body lay undiscovered for a day has faced court charged with murder.
item.title: Slain Queensland woman left at home for a day

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: The government’s expectation that 60 per cent of students on average would return to school on Wednesday was met, with some schools blowing that number out of the water.
item.title: Parent choice 'complicated matters' as class attendance soars on start of term 2

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: Two Perth families are among the minority not planning to send their children back to school this week, after an unexpectedly happy home-schooling experience.
item.title: Why my children will be staying at home: Perth mum’s sweet new routine

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Music lovers are frustrated by delays and uncertainty about refunds for entertainment events thrown into chaos by the coronavirus.
item.title: Ticket holders in limbo as live performances face uncertain future
